thread.title: Live coverage: Australia v New Zealand, 2nd ODI
thread.title_full: Live coverage: Australia v New Zealand, 2nd ODI

title: Live coverage: Australia v New Zealand, 2nd ODI
text:
Australia v New Zealand: Live blog, scores, video and coverage from 2nd ODI at Napier Staff writers, FOX SPORTS February 2, 2017 10:45am 
AUSTRALIA’S Chappell-Hadlee Trophy hopes go on the line on Thursday with New Zealand eager to close out the three-game series. 
Marcus Stoinis very nearly dragged Australia to what would’ve been an incredible comeback win in their series opener. 
His 146 not out was not enough, however, meaning Australia needs to win in Napier to level the series and make game three in Hamilton a decider. 
Australia will again be without interim captain and keeper Matthew Wade, who has flown home for further treatment on the back injury which ruled him out of game one. 
As in Auckland, Aaron Finch will captain and Peter Handscomb will take the gloves. 
New Zealand have been dealt a heavy blow, losing key opening batsman Martin Guptill to a hamstring injury. 
Squads: 
AUSTRALIA: Aaron Finch (capt), Pat Cummins, James Faulkner, Peter Handscomb, Josh Hazlewood, Travis Head, Sam heazlett, Sean Marsh, Glenn Maxwell, Billy Stanlake, Mitchell Starc, Marcus Stoinis, Adam Zampa. 
NEW ZEALAND: Kane Williamson (capt), Tom Blundell, Trent Boult, Neil Broom, Colin de Grandhomme, Lockie Ferguson, Martin Guptill, Matt Henry, Tom Latham, Colin Munro, Jimmy Neesham, Mitch Santner, Tim Southee, Ross Taylor.
